text: Viktor Leontievich Kopp () (, Yalta – 24 March 1930, Berlin) was a Russian diplomat active in Germany from 1918 to 1921. At the outset he belonged to the staff of the Soviet Ambassador to Germany, Adolph Joffe. In 1920 Kopp was recognised by the German government as head of the Soviet repatriation commission in Berlin. ==References== Category:1880 births Category:1930 deaths Category:People from Yalta Category:Ambassadors of the Soviet Union to Japan Category:Ambassadors of the Soviet Union to Sweden Category:Russian people of World War I
title: Viktor Kopp
